title: The French far right's Giorgia Meloni problem
summary: Is the Italian prime minister a 'reasonable' role model, as Jordan Bardella believes? His mentor, Marine Le Pen, isn't so sure – exposing a crack in their duo.

title: Macron calls on Asian and European countries to form 'a positive new alliance'
summary: While speaking at a defense and security summit in Singapore, President Emmanuel Macron also said Western countries must not 'abandon Gaza,' and urged Asian leaders not to see the war in Ukraine as a distant problem.

title: Trump says to double steel tariff to 50%, set to take place next week
summary: In a speech on Friday at a Pennsylvania steel plant, Trump also stressed that despite a recently announced partnership between US Steel and Nippon Steel, 'US Steel will continue to be controlled by the USA.'

title: In Poland, the grip of the anti-European far right weighs on the presidential election
summary: Ultraconservative and populist parties unexpected surge in the first round of the Polish presidential election on May 18, especially among young voters, revealed a waning of the traditional polarization in Polish political life.

title: 'Dogefather' Musk vows to stay Trump's 'friend and advisor' in Oval Office farewell
summary: Trump said Musk would still be "coming and going" from the White House after a turbulent four months in which DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency) cut tens of thousands of jobs, shuttered entire agencies and slashed foreign aid.

title: In Marseille, the (almost) hidden life of Paris supporters before the Champions League final
summary: As their club could join Olympique de Marseille (OM) among Champions League winners, Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) fans living in Marseille are torn between hope and fear of backlash.

title: Central Nigeria floods kill more than 115: 'The toll keeps rising,' officials say
summary: Rescue teams continued to search for missing residents after torrential rains late on Wednesday through early Thursday washed away and submerged dozens of homes in and around the town of Mokwa. The National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) described it as an 'unprecedented flood.'

title: US Supreme Court lets Trump revoke legal protections from 500,000 migrants
summary: The justices lifted on Friday a lower-court order that kept humanitarian parole protections in place for more than 500,000 migrants from four countries: Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela

title: Israel accuses Macron of waging a 'crusade against the Jewish state'
summary: Speaking at a summit in Singapore on Friday, President Emmanuel Macron said European countries should 'harden' their position on Israel, and that recognizing a Palestinian state, with some conditions, was 'a moral duty.'

title: In Côte d'Ivoire, the dangerous rise of the alcoholic beverage Vody
summary: Social media and the music scene made this cheap version of a vodka-based cocktail popular. Authorities are concerned and now trying to curb the trend.

title: Sweden takes notice of French report on Muslim Brotherhood infiltration
summary: A French Interior Ministry report, made public on May 21, has sparked controversy in Sweden, which was mentioned in the text. Sweden's government said it would commission a study into 'Islamist infiltration.'

title: Businesses left in the dark by uncertainty around US tariffs
summary: Within 24 hours, Donald Trump's tariffs were ruled illegal and then reinstated on appeal. These twists and turns have made the work of negotiators and businesses impossible.

title: Harvard's foreign students anxious after Trump takes aim at them
summary: Under the guise of combating antisemitism, the Trump administration has stepped up measures against the prestigious university and its admissions procedures for students from around the globe, despite contrary rulings from the courts.

title: How French police tracked the kidnappers of a crypto investor's relative
summary: Since Monday, May 26, police have carried out a series of raids targeting the suspected organizers of multiple kidnappings. Earlier in May, an initial investigation led to the rescue of a crypto investor's father and set police on the trail of a highly organized gang.

title: New Banksy mural appears in Marseille, depicting a lighthouse
summary: Banksy revealed the new work on Instagram on Thursday but its location had not been disclosed.

title: Romania's far right takes aim at France
summary: The Romanian presidential election was won on May 18 by pro-European candidate Nicusor Dan, but his nationalist opponent, George Simion, is contesting the result and accusing France of interference and manipulation.

title: Loretta Swit, Emmy-winning 'M.A.S.H.' actress,  has died at 87
summary: Publicist Harlan Boll says Swit died Friday at her home in New York City, likely from natural causes.

title: How artists dress: A work of art in itself
summary: The Louvre-Lens Museum is shining a spotlight on the clothing styles of painters, visual artists and sculptors through July. From Rosa Bonheur's blue smock to Joseph Beuys's uniform, it is a topic rarely explored.

title: Hegseth reassures US support for Indo-Pacific allies against 'imminent' threat of China
summary: Speaking at the Shangri-La Dialogue, a global security conference hosted by the International Institute for Security Studies, US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said China is no longer just building up its military forces to take Taiwan, it's 'actively training for it, every day.'

title: Czech justice minister resigns after accepting €40 million in bitcoin from convicted criminal
summary: Czech Justice Minister Pavel Blazek has stepped down following a scandal over the sale of bitcoins donated by a criminal convicted of drug trafficking.

title: Taylor Swift buys back the rights to her first six albums
summary: After years of dispute over the rights to the master recordings of her first six albums, American pop star Taylor Swift announced that she now owns all the music she has 'ever made.'

title: PSG's symbolic victory: Winning over French hearts
summary: For years, many in France rejoiced in seeing the capital's club fail. But the country is now widely backing the young team facing Inter Milan in the Champions League final.

title: Meta joins the race to develop augmented reality for the US military, alongside Anduril
summary: Mark Zuckerberg has once again partnered with Palmer Luckey, who designs equipment for the US military. The creator of the Oculus virtual reality headset, an early supporter of Donald Trump, left Facebook in 2017 amid controversy.

title: From Parc des Princes to Roland-Garros, this Paris neighborhood is an international sports hub
summary: This western Paris neighborhood boasts a record number of major sports facilities, including the stadium where Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) plays. Its future is already emerging as a key topic in the 2026 municipal election campaign.
